sen.j: 突棒（つくぼう）は、江戸時代に使用された捕り物道具のひとつである。
sen.e: Tsukubo is one of the tools for capturing criminals which were used in the Edo period.
Tsukubo is one of the tools for capturing criminals which was used in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス： were → was に訂正しました。
sen.e: Tsukubo is one of the tools for capturing criminals which was used in the Edo period.

sen.j: 刺股、袖搦ととも三道具の一種でもある。
sen.e: It is also one of the three tools along with Sasumata (two-pronged weapon) and Sodegarami (barbed staff).
It is also one of the three tools along with Sasumata (two-pronged weapon) and Sodegarami (pole weapon with multiple barbed heads).
sen.cmt: 袖搦の注釈を少々分かりやすく次のように変更しました。barbed staff → pole weapon with multiple barbed heads
sen.e: It is also one of the three tools along with Sasumata (two-pronged weapon) and Sodegarami (pole weapon with multiple barbed heads).

sen.j: 頭部は鉄製で、形はT字型であり、撞木に酷似している。
sen.e: It is T-shaped and looks very like shumoku (wooden bell hammer), with its head made of iron.
It is T-shaped and looks very much like shumoku (wooden bell hammer), with its head made of iron.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス： very like → very much like に訂正しました。
sen.e: It is T-shaped and looks very much like shumoku (wooden bell hammer), with its head made of iron.

sen.j: 多くの歯がついていて長い柄（2-3メートルほど）をつけている。
sen.e: It has a lot of spines and a long shaft (about two or three meters).
It has a lot of spikes and a long shaft (about two or three meters).
sen.cmt: spines → spikes に変更しました。
sen.e: It has a lot of spikes and a long shaft (about two or three meters).

sen.j: 袖搦のように、犯人の衣服、髪をからめて動きを制圧する。
sen.e: It is used in the same manner as Sodegarami, catching a criminal's clothes and hair and suppressing his/her movement.
It is used in the same manner as Sodegarami, catching a criminal's clothes and hair and suppressing his/her movement.
It is used in the same manner as Sodegarami, catching a criminal's clothes and hair and suppressing his/her movement.

sen.j: 現在は突棒術を教える流派は少ない。
sen.e: At present there are only a few schools that teach an art of using Tsukubo.
At present there are only a few schools that teach an art of using Tsukubo as a weapon.
sen.cmt: art of ～というふうに始まっているので、「芸術」との誤解を招かぬよう、Tsukubo の後にas a weapon を加えました。
sen.e: At present there are only a few schools that teach an art of using Tsukubo as a weapon.
